clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Pancreatitis: Study of Possible Etiologies and Risk Factors Affecting Outcome
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Pancreatitis: Study of Possible Etiologies and Risk Factors Affecting Outcome (Hospital Based Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to assess the frequency of different etiologies of acute pancreatitis in our locality & assess the effect of different risk factors on outcome of the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The frequency of different etiologies of AP in our locality
primary_outcome.description: At the end of study, total number of patients of each etiology of acute pancreatitis will be calculated as (Gallstones, Alcohol, triglyceridemia, Idiopathic, ERCP,..)

secondary_outcome.measure: Outcome of the patients according to the Atlanta Classification 2012 revision
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of each risk factor on outcome as progression to mild, moderate severe and severe pancreatitis "according to the Atlanta Classification 2012 revision",
Effect of each risk factor on hospital duration of stay
Effect of each risk factor on rate of transfer to ICU
Effect of each risk factor on mortality

study_pop.textblock: All patients admitted in assuit university hospital during the period of the study and diagnosed as acute pancreatitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-
Diagnosis of acute pancreatitis according to the following: the presence of two of the three following criteria:
- abdominal pain consistent with the disease
- serum amylase and or lipase greater than three times the upper limit of normal
- characteristic findings from abdominal imaging Contrast-enhanced computed tomographic (CECT) and or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the pancreas
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria .

responsible_party.investigator_title: Specialist of tropical medicine and gastroenterology
